intro: Tuberaria variabilis var. cinerea, commonly known as the ash-gray tuberaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are typically covered in a fine, ash-colored pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. This species is well adapted to arid and rocky environments, making it a hardy choice for xeriscaping.
